page.title: 01FORTH PORT AUTHORITY
page.content:
The block allocated to St Mary's Primary School is 75 % sea. Much of the area is used by the Forth Port Authority for Leith Docks and related industries.
However within the small land mass left unoccupied there is a surprising variety of interesting locations.
This ranges from a Cricket Club which is 100yrs old to the local graveyard which contains the graves of seamen killed in a naval engagement in the Second World War. The area is very historical and includes features such as the site of several Black PLague burial grounds.
